create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE students (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100), age INT, grade VARCHAR(10));
insert_statements: INSERT INTO students (id, name, age, grade) VALUES (1, 'Alice', 18, 'A'), (2, 'Bob', 19, 'B'), (3, 'Charlie', 18, 'A'), (4, 'David', 20, 'C');
sql: SELECT name, age FROM students WHERE grade = 'B';

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE products (product_id INT PRIMARY KEY, product_name VARCHAR(100), price DECIMAL(10, 2));
insert_statements: INSERT INTO products (product_id, product_name, price) VALUES (101, 'Laptop', 1200.00), (102, 'Mouse', 25.00), (103, 'Keyboard', 75.00);
sql: INSERT INTO products (product_id, product_name, price) VALUES (104, 'Monitor', 300.00);

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE employees (employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_name VARCHAR(100), salary DECIMAL(10, 2));
insert_statements: INSERT INTO employees (employee_id, employee_name, salary) VALUES (1, 'John Doe', 50000.00), (2, 'Jane Smith', 60000.00), (3, 'Peter Jones', 45000.00);
sql: UPDATE employees SET salary = 55000.00 WHERE employee_name LIKE 'John%';

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE orders (order_id INT PRIMARY KEY, customer_id INT, order_date DATE);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO orders (order_id, customer_id, order_date) VALUES (1, 10, '2023-01-15'), (2, 11, '2023-01-16'), (3, 10, '2023-01-17');
sql: DELETE FROM orders WHERE customer_id = 10;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE categories (category_id INT PRIMARY KEY, category_name VARCHAR(100));
insert_statements: INSERT INTO categories (category_id, category_name) VALUES (1, 'Electronics'), (2, 'Books'), (3, 'Food');
sql: REPLACE INTO categories (category_id, category_name) VALUES (4, 'Clothing');

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE fruits (fruit_id INT PRIMARY KEY, fruit_name VARCHAR(50), weight DECIMAL(5, 2));
insert_statements: INSERT INTO fruits (fruit_id, fruit_name, weight) VALUES (1, 'Apple', 0.2), (2, 'Banana', 0.15), (3, 'Orange', 0.25), (4, 'Grape', 0.05);
sql: SELECT fruit_name FROM fruits WHERE fruit_name = 'Banana';

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE sales (sale_id INT PRIMARY KEY, product_id INT, sale_amount DECIMAL(10, 2), sale_date DATE);
sql: SELECT product_id, sale_amount FROM sales WHERE sale_amount < 100.00;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE articles (article_id INT PRIMARY KEY, title VARCHAR(255), publish_date DATE);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO articles (article_id, title, publish_date) VALUES (1, 'Article A', '2023-01-01'), (2, 'Article B', '2023-01-05'), (3, 'Article C', '2023-01-10');
sql: SELECT title FROM articles WHERE publish_date = '2023-01-05';

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE books (book_id INT PRIMARY KEY, title VARCHAR(255), author VARCHAR(100));
insert_statements: INSERT INTO books (book_id, title, author) VALUES (1, 'The Great Gatsby', 'F. Scott Fitzgerald'), (2, '1984', 'George Orwell'), (3, 'To Kill a Mockingbird', 'Harper Lee');
sql: SELECT book_id, title FROM books WHERE title LIKE '%Great%';

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE departments (dept_id INT PRIMARY KEY, dept_name VARCHAR(100));
CREATE TABLE employees_v2 (emp_id INT PRIMARY KEY, emp_name VARCHAR(100), dept_id INT);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO departments (dept_id, dept_name) VALUES (1, 'HR'), (2, 'IT'), (3, 'Finance');
INSERT INTO employees_v2 (emp_id, emp_name, dept_id) VALUES (101, 'Alice', 1), (102, 'Bob', 2), (103, 'Charlie', 1), (104, 'David', 3);
sql: SELECT d.dept_name, COUNT(e.emp_id) FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees_v2 e ON d.dept_id = e.dept_id GROUP BY d.dept_name ORDER BY d.dept_name;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE transactions (transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY, account_id INT, amount DECIMAL(10, 2), transaction_date DATE);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO transactions (transaction_id, account_id, amount, transaction_date) VALUES (1, 10, 50.00, '2023-01-01'), (2, 11, 75.00, '2023-01-01'), (3, 10, 120.00, '2023-01-02');
sql: SELECT transaction_date, SUM(amount) FROM transactions GROUP BY transaction_date ORDER BY transaction_date;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE sensor_data (id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT, sensor_type VARCHAR(50), value DECIMAL(10, 2), timestamp DATETIME);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO sensor_data (sensor_type, value, timestamp) VALUES ('Temperature', 25.5, '2023-01-01 10:00:00'), ('Humidity', 60.2, '2023-01-01 10:00:00'), ('Temperature', 26.1, '2023-01-01 10:05:00');
sql: SELECT sensor_type, AVG(value) FROM sensor_data GROUP BY sensor_type;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE products_2 (product_id INT PRIMARY KEY, product_name VARCHAR(100), price DECIMAL(10, 2), category VARCHAR(50));
insert_statements: INSERT INTO products_2 (product_id, product_name, price, category) VALUES (1, 'Laptop', 1200.00, 'Electronics'), (2, 'Desk', 250.00, 'Furniture'), (3, 'Monitor', 300.00, 'Electronics'), (4, 'Chair', 150.00, 'Furniture');
sql: SELECT product_name FROM products_2 WHERE category = 'Electronics';

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE employees_v3 (emp_id INT PRIMARY KEY, emp_name VARCHAR(100), dept_id INT, salary DECIMAL(10, 2));
CREATE TABLE departments_v2 (dept_id INT PRIMARY KEY, dept_name VARCHAR(100));
insert_statements: INSERT INTO employees_v3 (emp_id, emp_name, dept_id, salary) VALUES (1, 'Alice', 10, 60000.00), (2, 'Bob', 20, 75000.00), (3, 'Charlie', 10, 55000.00), (4, 'David', 30, 80000.00);
INSERT INTO departments_v2 (dept_id, dept_name) VALUES (10, 'HR'), (20, 'IT'), (30, 'Finance');
sql: SELECT e.emp_name, d.dept_name FROM employees_v3 e JOIN departments_v2 d ON e.dept_id = d.dept_id ORDER BY e.salary DESC;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE customers_v2 (customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY, customer_name VARCHAR(100), signup_date DATE);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO customers_v2 (customer_id, customer_name, signup_date) VALUES (1, 'Alice', '2023-01-01'), (2, 'Bob', '2023-01-05'), (3, 'Charlie', '2023-01-10');
sql: SELECT customer_name FROM customers_v2 WHERE signup_date = '2023-01-05';

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE users_3 (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100), email VARCHAR(100));
CREATE TABLE orders_4 (order_id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT, order_date DATE);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO users_3 (id, name, email) VALUES (1, 'Alice', 'alice@example.com'), (2, 'Bob', 'bob@example.com'), (3, 'Charlie', 'charlie@example.com');
sql: SELECT u.name, COUNT(o.order_id) FROM users_3 u LEFT JOIN orders_4 o ON u.id = o.user_id GROUP BY u.name ORDER BY u.name;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE employees_v4 (employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_name VARCHAR(100), manager_id INT);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO employees_v4 (employee_id, employee_name, manager_id) VALUES (1, 'Alice', NULL), (2, 'Bob', 1), (3, 'Charlie', 1), (4, 'David', 2);
sql: SELECT employee_name FROM employees_v4 ORDER BY employee_name;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE products_v4 (product_id INT PRIMARY KEY, product_name VARCHAR(100), price DECIMAL(10, 2));
insert_statements: INSERT INTO products_v4 (product_id, product_name, price) VALUES (1, 'Laptop', 1200.00), (2, 'Desk', 250.00), (3, 'Monitor', 300.00);
sql: SELECT product_name, price FROM products_v4 ORDER BY price DESC;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE inventory (item_id INT PRIMARY KEY, item_name VARCHAR(100), stock_quantity INT);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO inventory (item_id, item_name, stock_quantity) VALUES (1, 'Pen', 100), (2, 'Notebook', 50), (3, 'Eraser', 75);
sql: UPDATE inventory SET stock_quantity = 80 WHERE stock_quantity < 60;

create_table_statements: CREATE TABLE events (event_id INT PRIMARY KEY, event_name VARCHAR(100), event_date DATE);
insert_statements: INSERT INTO events (event_id, event_name, event_date) VALUES (1, 'Meeting', '2023-06-01'), (2, 'Conference', '2023-06-15'), (3, 'Workshop', '2023-07-01');
sql: SELECT event_name FROM events WHERE event_name = 'Meeting';
